page.title: 18A FARM IN NORTH-WEST PENRITH
page.content: Greengill Farm is situated down the road from the Golf Course.It is mainly a dairy farm but the occasional wheat crop is grown.There are a few residents living in farm property that have nothing to do with the farm but mostly the people living in the five houses are farm hands or owners of land.A big pond is next to two of the houses on which ducks and fish swim.The owner of the farm lives in a big house on the outskirts of the farm.There are about three acres of farm land.A long drive leads up to the houses which on a hot day is sheltered by ash and other trees.In the hedgerows grow Dog Daisies,Poppies and Fox-gloves.They milk the cows at six o'clock in the morning and four o'clock in the afternoon.After which they are put in the byres for the night until the next busy day.
